raw_text: We decided to follow the experimental settings of Jiang et al (2008a; 2008b) on CTB 5.0 and Zhang and Clark (2008) on CTB 4.0 since they reported the best performances on joint word segmentation and POS tagging using the training materials only derived from the corpora
clean_text: We decided to follow the experimental settings of Jiang et al (2008a; 2008b) on CTB 5.0 and Zhang and Clark (2008) on CTB 4.0 since they reported the best performances on joint word segmentation and POS tagging using the training materials only derived from the corpora.

citing_paper_authors: Jenny Rose, Finkel | Christopher D., Manning
raw_text: Zhang and Clark (2008) built a perceptron-based joint segmenter and part-of-speech (POS) tagger for Chinese, and Toutanova and Cherry (2009) learned a joint model of lemmatization and POS tagging which outperformed a pipelined model. Adler and Elhadad (2006) presented an HMMbased approach for unsupervised joint morphological segmentation and tagging of Hebrew, and Goldberg and Tsarfaty (2008) developed a joint model of segmentation, tagging and parsing of He brew, based on lattice parsing
clean_text: Zhang and Clark (2008) built a perceptron-based joint segmenter and part-of-speech (POS) tagger for Chinese, and Toutanova and Cherry (2009) learned a joint model of lemmatization and POS tagging which outperformed a pipelined model.

citing_paper_authors: Xian, Qian | Yang, Liu
raw_text: Previous joint models mainly focus on word segmentation and POS tagging task, such as the virtual nodes method (Qian et al2010), cascaded linear model (Jiang et al2008a) ,perceptron (Zhang and Clark, 2008), sub-word based stacked learning (Sun, 2011), re ranking (Jiang et al2008b)
clean_text: Previous joint models mainly focus on word segmentation and POS tagging task, such as the virtual nodes method (Qian et al2010), cascaded linear model (Jiang et al2008a), perceptron (Zhang and Clark, 2008), sub-word based stacked learning (Sun, 2011), re ranking (Jiang et al2008b).

citing_paper_authors: Xiaofeng, Yu | Wai, Lam
raw_text: Zhangand Clark (2008) employed the generalized per ceptron algorithm to train a statistical model for joint segmentation and POS tagging, and applied multiple-beam search algorithm for fast decoding. Toutanova et al (2008) presented a model capturing the linguistic intuition that a semantic argument frame is a joint structure, with strong dependencies among the arguments
clean_text: Zhang and Clark (2008) employed the generalized perceptron algorithm to train a statistical model for joint segmentation and POS tagging, and applied multiple-beam search algorithm for fast decoding.

citing_paper_authors: Yue, Zhang | Stephen, Clark
raw_text: We show that the standard beam-search algorithm can be used as an efficient decoder for the global linear model of Zhang and Clark (2008) for joint word segmentation andPOS-tagging, achieving a significant speed improvement
clean_text: We show that the standard beam-search algorithm can be used as an efficient decoder for the global linear model of Zhang and Clark (2008) for joint word segmentation and POS-tagging, achieving a significant speed improvement.

citing_paper_authors: Yue, Zhang | Stephen, Clark
raw_text: In our 10-fold cross validation experiments with the Chinese Tree bank, our system performed over 10 times as fast as Zhang and Clark (2008) with little ac curacy loss
clean_text: In our 10-fold cross validation experiments with the Chinese Tree bank, our system performed over 10 times as fast as Zhang and Clark (2008) with little accuracy loss.

citing_paper_authors: Yue, Zhang | Stephen, Clark
raw_text: In our previous work (Zhang and Clark, 2008), which we refer to as Z& amp; C08 from now on, we used an approximate decoding algorithm that keeps track of a set of partially built structures for each character, which can be seenas a dynamic programming chart which is greatly reduced by pruning
clean_text: In our previous work (Zhang and Clark, 2008), which we refer to as Z&C08 from now on, we used an approximate decoding algorithm that keeps track of a set of partially built structures for each character, which can be seen as a dynamic programming chart which is greatly reduced by pruning.
